p: Avocado ( Persea americana Mill) belongs to the Lauraceae family composed of 50 genera and approximately 2,500â€“3,000 species ( Rohwer, 1993; Chanderbali et al., 2008). Three well recognized horticultural races exist: (1) the Mexican race ( P. americana var. drymifolia) adapted to the tropical highlands; (2) the Guatemalan race ( P. americana var. guatemalensis, L.O. Williams) adapted preferentially to medium elevations in the tropics; and (3) the West-Indian race ( P. americana var. americana) cultivated in the lowland humid tropics ( Chanderbali et al., 2008; Ibarra-Laclette et al., 2015).
